question: Technology  has  made  it  possible  for us  to  reach  out  to  more  students,  and  it has  also  made  it  possible  for  us  to deliver  the  same  lessons  in  a  much  more ________ manner. SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: resourceful ‘Resourceful’ means to able to ﬁnd and use different ways to achieve your goals. The given sentence states that technology has also made it possible for us to deliver the same lessons in a much more resourceful manner. Hence, ‘resourceful’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: You  can  tell  yourself  that  you  would be  willing  to  lose  everything  you  have  in order  to  get  something  you  want:  all  of those  things  you're  willing  to  lose  are what make you _________. SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: recognisable ‘Recognisable’ means easy to identify or recognise. The given sentence states that all of those things you’re willing to lose are what make you recognisable. Hence, ‘recognisable’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select  the  most  appropriate  form and  tense  of  the  bracketed  verb  in  the following sentence to ﬁll in the blank. I'm  busy  today.  I'd  rather  we  _______  (has) the meeting tomorrow. SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: had Simple past tense is used after “ would rather / ’ d rather ” when the subjects are different. In the given sentence, the subjects ‘I’ and ‘we’ are different. Therefore, past form(V 2 ) of the verb will be used. Hence, ‘had(V 2 )’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  difference  between  a  male  and a  female  still  ______  in  our  society.  In  this era  where  women  have  such  great achievements  in  every  ﬁeld,  still  in  some sections  of  our  community,  a  man  is always termed as superior to women. SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: persists ‘Persist’ means to continue to exist. The given sentence states that the difference between a male and a female still persists in our society. Hence, ‘persists’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Their  plan  of  acquisition  was  _______ ﬂawed  from  the  very  beginning;  it  was bound to fail. SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: fatally ‘Fatally’ means in a way that leads to failure. The given sentence states that their plan of acquisition was fatally ﬂawed from the very beginning. It was bound to fail. Hence, ‘fatally’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: It  may  seem  _______  that  the  hours of  women's  chores  at  home  have  not declined  inspite  of  the  availability  of many  appliances  (gas,  electric  ranges, washing machines, etc.) SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: perplexing ‘Perplexing’ means diﬃcult to understand. The given sentence states that it may seem perplexing that the hours of women’s chores at home have not declined in spite of the availability of many appliances (gas, electric ranges, washing machines, etc.) Hence, ‘perplexing’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  seven  _______  for  accreditation were  presented  in  a  seminar  organised by the university. SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: criteria The given sentence needs a plural noun after the plural word ‘seven’. ‘Criteria’ is the plural form of ‘criterion’. Hence, ‘criteria’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  business  operates  ________  the same way as the other businesses did. SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: much The phrase ‘much the same’ means very similar. The given sentence states that the business operates much the same way as the other businesses did. Hence, ‘much’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  tree  lost  many  of  its  ________  in the heavy rain and storm. SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Evening)

solution.explanation: branches ‘Branch’ is one of the parts of a tree which grows out from the main trunk. The given sentence states that the tree lost many of its branches in the heavy rain and storm. Hence, ‘branches’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: A  dam  is  a  barrier  that  stops  the ﬂow  of  water  and  results  in  the  creation of a______. SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Evening)

solution.explanation: reservoir ‘Reservoir’ means a place for storing liquid. The given sentence states that a dam is a barrier that stops the ﬂow of water and results in the creation of a reservoir. Hence, ‘reservoir’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Spending  quality  time  with  friends and  family  is  also_____  to  have  a  healthy daily  routine.  These  happy  moments release happy hormones in the body. SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Evening)

solution.explanation: obligatory ‘Obligatory’ means required to be done. The given sentence states that spending quality time with friends and family is also obligatory to have a healthy daily routine. Hence, ‘obligatory’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: ________, I'm going to walk my dog. SSC CHSL Tier II  (18/11/2024)

solution.explanation: Now ‘Now’ is used in present continuous tense to indicate an activity that is currently happening or going to happen. Hence, ‘now’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select the most appropriate article(s) to ﬁll in the blanks. I was in ______ state of unconsciousness www.ssccglpinnacle.com                                                 Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Fill in the blanks for about half ________ hour. SSC CHSL Tier II  (18/11/2024)

solution.explanation: a ; an Article ‘A’ is used before the words starting with a consonant sound - (a conversation, a story). Whereas, the article ‘An’ is used before the words starting with a vowel sound(an imminent danger, an apple). In the given sentence, ‘state’ starts with a consonant sound and ‘hour’ starts with a vowel sound. Hence, ‘a ; an’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  rising  rate  of  inﬂation  is making life very hard for ________ poor. SSC CHSL Tier II  (18/11/2024)

solution.explanation: the When article ‘the’ is used before an adjective, it becomes a common noun and refers to all those denoted by the adjective. ‘The poor’ refers to all the people who are poor. Hence, ‘the’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He has not ___ returned the money. SSC CHSL Tier II  (18/11/2024)

solution.explanation: yet ‘Yet’ is used in present perfect tense with ‘not’ to indicate that something has not happened till this time. Similarly, in the given sentence, the person has not returned the money till this time. Hence, ‘yet’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: It’s  funny  how  every  time  he  fails  to apply the _________ and _______ the glass. SSC CHSL Tier II  (18/11/2024)

solution.explanation: brakes; breaks ‘Brakes’ are the components of a vehicle used to stop it. ‘Break’ means to shatter something into pieces. The given sentence states that it’s funny how every time he fails to apply that brakes and breaks the glass. Hence, ‘brakes; breaks’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: His  family  lives  _______  Mahu  in Madhya Pradesh. SSC CHSL Tier II  (18/11/2024)

solution.explanation: at ‘At’ is used to indicate a speciﬁc place within a larger location. Similarly, ‘Mahu’ is a speciﬁc place in Madhya Pradesh. Hence, ‘at’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Accepting  how  wonderful  you  truly are  and  incorporating  this  _______  into your  attitude  and  personality  is  perhaps one  of  the  most  diﬃcult  things  to  do  in life. SSC MTS 30/09/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: insight ‘Insight’ means an accurate and deep understanding. The given sentence states that accepting how wonderful you truly are and incorporating this insight into your attitude and personality is perhaps one of the most diﬃcult things to do in life. Hence, ‘insight’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Please  put  the  dishes  in  the  _______ after you ﬁnish eating. SSC MTS 01/10/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: sink ‘Sink’ means a basin in a kitchen for washing dishes. The given sentence states a request to put the dishes in the sink after you ﬁnish eating. Hence, ‘sink’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: My  grandparents  live  in  a  beautiful house _________ the countryside. SSC MTS 01/10/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: in ‘In’ is used for larger, more general locations, such as cities, states, countries, etc. ‘Countryside’ is a general location, meaning the land and scenery of a rural area. Hence, ‘in’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: In  the  following  passage,  some words  have  been  deleted.  Read  the passage  carefully  and  select  the  most appropriate option to ﬁll in the blanks. Leif  Erikson  is  a  Viking  ________  believed to  have  sailed  from  the  Green  Lands  to Vinland.  Vinland  is  now  thought  to  be  the northern  tip  of  Canada's  Newfoundland island  where  ________  found  evidence  of Erikson's ________ in 1960s. SSC MTS 07/10/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: explorer; archaeologists; settlement ‘Explorer’ means someone who travels to places about which very little is known. ‘Archaeologist’ is a scientist who studies human history by digging up human remains and artifacts. ‘Settlement’ means a place where people come to live. The given sentence states that Leif Erikson is a Viking explorer. Vinland is now thought to be the northern tip of Canada’s Newfoundland island where archaeologists found evidence of Erikson’s settlement in 1960s. Hence, ‘explorer; archaeologists; settlement’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select the most appropriate idiom/phrase to ﬁll in the blank. My  car  __________  on  the  way  to  college yesterday. SSC MTS 08/10/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: broke down ‘Broke down’ is the past form of the phrasal verb ‘break down’, which means to stop working. The given sentence states that my car broke down on the way to college yesterday. Hence, ‘broke down’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  manager  swiftly  overtook  him, ____________  effortlessly  past  the  skinny Englishman, with a practiced ease. SSC MTS 09/10/2024 (Evening)

solution.explanation: sliding ‘Sliding’ means moving smoothly and effortlessly. The given sentence states that the manager swiftly overtook him, sliding effortlessly past the skinny Englishman, with a practised ease. Hence, ‘sliding’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  charismatic  leader's  speeches were  known  for  their  ________  impact  on motivating people to take positive actions. SSC MTS 14/10/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: profound ‘Profound’ means very great or intense. The given sentence states that the charismatic leader’s speeches were known for their profound impact on motivating people to take positive actions. Hence, ‘profound’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  rising  interest  in  and  concern about animal welfare resulted in legislative  laws  and  the  formation  of  The Animal______Committee in many nations. SSC MTS 15/10/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Ethics ‘Ethics’ means moral principles that govern a person's behaviour or the conducting of an activity. The given sentence states that the rising interest in and concern about animal welfare resulted in legislative laws and the formation of The Animal Ethics Committee in many nations. Hence, ‘ethics’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select  the  most  appropriate  degree of comparison to ﬁll in the blank. Work in this oﬃce is done in the_____way. SSC MTS 15/10/2024 (Evening)

solution.explanation: least eﬃcient Article ‘the’ is used before the superlative degree. ‘Least eﬃcient’ is the correct superlative degree of ‘eﬃcient’. Hence, ‘least eﬃcient’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  coaches  decided  to______  the regulations  more  strictly  because  the candidates  were  not  paying  attention during their training sessions. SSC MTS 16/10/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: enforce ‘Enforce’ means to cause a law or rule to be obeyed. The given sentence states that the coaches decided to enforce the regulations more strictly because the candidates were not paying attention during their training sessions. Hence, ‘enforce’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: There  was  no  one  left  in  the  world whom they could call _______. SSC MTS 17/10/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: theirs ‘Theirs’ is a possessive pronoun used with the pronoun ‘they’. ‘Their’ is a possessive adjective used with a noun. As there is no noun after the blank, we can not use possessive adjective. Hence, ‘theirs’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  begin  to  pronounce  the  sequence of  words  and  numbers  that  will  prevent her from giving him a piece of her ______. SSC MTS 17/10/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: mind ‘Give someone a piece of one’s mind’ is an idiom which means to speak to someone in an angry or critical way. The given sentence states that I begin to pronounce the sequence of words and numbers that will prevent her from giving him a piece of her mind. Hence, ‘mind’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Due  to_______  'eve  teasing',  parents conclude  that  it  is  not  worth  the  danger of sending their daughters to school. SSC MTS 18/10/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: widespread ‘Widespread’ means happening in many places. The given passage states that due to widespread ‘eve teasing’, parents conclude that it is not worth the danger of sending their daughters to school. Hence, ‘widespread’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  could  _____  the  reason  for  being _____. SSC MTS 21/10/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ﬁnd; ﬁned ‘Find’ means to discover something by chance. ‘Fined’ means charged with an amount of money as a punishment for not obeying a rule or law. The given sentence states that I could ﬁnd the reason for being ﬁned. Hence, ‘ﬁnd; ﬁned’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  was  a  ______,  ______,  _______ astronaut. SSC MTS 22/10/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: smart, tall, Indian The correct order of adjectives is- opinion, size, origin. ‘Smart’ is an adjective expressing an opinion. ‘Tall’ indicates size. ‘Indian’ indicates origin. Hence, ‘smart, tall, Indian’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  writer's  __________  prose resonated  with  readers,  evoking  powerful emotions. SSC MTS 23/10/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: eloquent ‘Eloquent’ means giving a clear and strong message. The given sentence states that the writer’s eloquent prose resonated with readers, evoking powerful emotions. Hence, ‘eloquent’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: In the following passage, some www.ssccglpinnacle.com                                                 Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Fill in the blanks words  have  been  deleted.  Read  the passage  carefully  and  select  the  most appropriate option to ﬁll in the blanks. Michael  Jackson  is  known  as  the  King  of Pop.  He  ________  his  own  genre  of  music, Pop.  His  music  is  spreading  its  inﬂuence and popularity ________ the world. SSC MTS 28/10/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: dominates; around ‘Dominate’ means to be the most important person or thing in a ﬁeld. The phrase ‘around the world’ means everywhere in the world. The given sentence states that Michael Jackson is known as the King of Pop. He dominates his own genre of music, Pop. His music is spreading its inﬂuence and popularity around the world. Hence, ‘dominates; around’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He  is  going  to  ______  the  campaign against  excessive  use  of  _______  in  local production units. SSC MTS 30/10/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: lead ‘Lead’ in the 1 st blank means to guide in a direction. ‘Lead’ in the 2 nd blank means a very heavy, soft, dark grey poisonous substance. The given sentence states that he is going to lead the campaign against excessive use of lead in local production units. Hence, ‘lead’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Despite facing numerous challenges,  the  team  successfully  ______ the project ahead of schedule. SSC MTS 04/11/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: completed ‘Completed’ is the correct verb to use here, indicating simple past tense. ‘Successfully’ is an adverb which modiﬁes the verb completed. Hence, ‘completed’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  assignment  was  ______  early  in the morning. SSC MTS 12/11/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: due ‘Due’ means expected at a certain time. The given sentence states that the assignment was due early in the morning. Hence, ‘due’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  teacher  asked  the  students  to remain  ____,  but  the  noise  continued  to ____.  She  ﬁnally  had  to  raise  her  voice  to gain control. SSC MTS 12/11/2024 (Evening)

solution.explanation: quiet; rise ‘Quiet’ means not making any noise or disturbance. ‘Rise’ means to increase in amount or level. The given sentence states that the teacher asked the students to remain quiet, but the noise continued to rise. She ﬁnally had to raise her voice to gain control. Hence, ‘quiet; rise’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: With  the  increasing  reliance  on digital systems, ensuring robust cybersecurity  measures  is  __________  to protect against online threats. SSC MTS 13/11/2024 (Evening)

solution.explanation: paramount ‘Paramount’ means more important than anything else. The given sentence states that with the increasing reliance on digital systems, ensuring robust cybersecurity measures is paramount to protect against online threats. Hence, ‘paramount’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Vinod  had  a  ________  escape  in  the car accident SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: narrow The phrase ‘narrow escape’ means a situation in which an accident or other unfortunate incident is only just avoided. The given sentence states that Vinod had a narrow escape in the car accident. Hence, 'narrow' is the most appropriate answer.

question: The group of travellers were wonderstruck by the ________ of the coin. SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: weight The given sentence states that the group of travellers were wonderstruck by the weight of the coin. Hence, ‘weight’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Two  of  the  fugitives  managed  to remain  free  by  adeptly  avoiding  the _________ of the police. SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: pursuit ‘Pursuit’ means the act of following someone to try to catch him. The given sentence states that two of the fugitives managed to remain free by adeptly avoiding the pursuit of the police. Hence, ‘pursuit’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  have  postponed  this  movie outing  too  many  times,  so  we  are  going tomorrow, come _____ or shine. SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: rain The given sentence states that we have

question: He  had  _____  the  ______  into smaller clips. SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: clipped, clipping ‘Clipped’ means cut short neatly & ‘clipping’ means an article cut from a newspaper or magazine. The given sentence states that he had clipped the clipping into smaller clips. Hence, ‘clipped, clipping’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: After  years  of  ﬁghts  with  his neighbour  Ram,  Shekhar  decided  to  hold out the _______ and invited Ram for tea. SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: olive branch ‘Olive branch’ is an idiom which means an offer or gesture of conciliation or goodwill. The given sentence states that after years of ﬁghts with his neighbour Ram, Shekhar decided to hold out the olive branch and invited Ram for tea. Hence, ‘olive branch’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: To  __________  the  ticket,  Amith  had to visit the travel agency many times. SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: conﬁrm ‘Conﬁrm’ means to be sure of something. The given sentence states that to conﬁrm the ticket, Amith had to visit the travel agency many times. Hence, ‘conﬁrm’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Kamal  is  not  willing  to  purchase  a house  on  the  12th  ﬂoor  of  a  sea-side apartment,  as  she  is  fearful  of  heights. She is suffering from ___________. SSC CGL 13/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: acrophobia ‘Acrophobia’ is an irrational fear of heights. The given sentence states that Kamal is not willing to purchase a house on the 12th ﬂoor of a sea-side apartment, as she is fearful of heights and she is suffering from acrophobia. Hence, ‘acrophobia’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Ram went to _____ an ice cream. SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: buy The given sentence states that Ram went to buy an ice cream. Hence, ‘buy’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select  the  most  appropriate  verb  / verb phrase to ﬁll in the blank. They  _______  their  house  for  the  past  two months,  and  it’s  ﬁnally  starting  to  look fantastic. SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: have been renovating Perfect continuous tense is used with ‘for/since’ indicating the period of time. ‘Plural subject (they) + have been + V ing ’ is the correct grammatical structure of present perfect continuous tense. Hence, ‘have been renovating’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  US  ________  building  was  built in the year 1800. SSC CGL 19/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: capitol ‘Capitol’ means the building in which the US Congress meets. The given sentence states that the US capitol building was built in the year 1800. Hence, 'capitol' is the most appropriate answer.

question: Sharat  is  always  ___________  about showing  up  for  work  because  he  believes that tardiness gets us nowhere. SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: punctual ‘Punctual’ means doing something at the agreed or proper time. The given sentence states that Sharat is always punctual about showing up for work because he believes that tardiness gets us nowhere. Hence, 'punctual' is the most appropriate answer.

question: Raj  is  very  interested  in  studying human  psychology,  so  he  decided  to pursue his master’s degree in __________. SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Psychology The given sentence talks about the interest of Raj in studying human psychology. Hence, ‘psychology’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  mother  couldn’t  ______  such  an insult from her son in front of the others. SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: bear ‘Bear’ means to tolerate or accept something. The given sentence states that the mother couldn’t bear such an insult from her son in front of the others. Hence, ‘bear’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select  the  most  appropriate  verb  / verb phrase to ﬁll in the blank. Akshaya  __________  hard  for  the  entrance exam and received a high score. SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: studied The given sentence is in the past tense, so it must have the verb in the past form(V 2 ). Hence, ‘studied(V 2 )’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I like bread made up of corn ______. SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: ﬂour ‘Flour’ means powdered grain, especially of wheat. The given sentence states that I like bread made up of corn. Hence, ‘ﬂour’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select  the  most  appropriate  verb  / verb phrase to ﬁll in the blank. The  team  ____________  the  championship before their star player got injured. SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: had won If two actions took place in the past then the 1st action must be in the Past perfect tense(Had + V3) and the 2nd action must be in the Simple Past tense (V2). The ﬁrst action is winning the championship. Hence, ‘had won (V3)’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Yesterday,  I  ate  only  a  ____  of apples for my dinner. SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: pair ‘Pair’ means a set of two things. The given sentence states that yesterday, I ate only a pair of apples for my dinner. Hence ‘pair’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: In  both  countries  we  have  leaders of_____ ability. SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: exceptional ‘Exceptional’ means much greater or better than usual. The given sentence states that we have leaders of exceptional ability in both countries. Hence ‘exceptional’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: It  took  4  hours  straight  to _______the deal with the regional company. SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: close ‘Close’ is the correct verb to use with ‘deal’. ‘Closing the deal’ means to make a successful business arrangement with someone. Hence, ‘close’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select  the  most  appropriate  option that  can  best  replace  the  bracketed  word to ﬁll in the blank. His  ________  stature  was  not  a  measure of his overall personality. (scrawny) SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: thin ‘Scrawny’ means unattractively thin and bony. The given sentence states that his thin stature was not a measure of his overall personality. Hence, ‘thin’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select the most appropriate homonym to ﬁll in the blank. ________is a red-coloured root vegetable. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Beet - a round, dark red vegetable that grows in the ground and is usually cooked and eaten cold Beat - to defeat somebody Bit - a small amount or piece of something. Bead - a small, round ball of glass, plastic, or wood that is used for making jewellery.

question: Both  the  criminals  were  cruel  and ______. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: brutal ‘Brutal’ means savagely violent. The given sentence states that both the criminals were cruel and brutal. Hence, ‘brutal’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  was  in  the________  of  a  meeting when somebody called me. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: middle The phrase ‘in the middle of’ means involved in some activity. The given sentence states that I was involved in a meeting when somebody called me. Hence, 'middle' is the most appropriate answer.

question: After  a  day  long  trek,  we  were  so tired that we were ready to _________. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Hit the sack- to go to bed or sleep.

question: Select the most appropriate homonym to ﬁll in the blank. Ravi is _______. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: bald ‘Bald’ means having no hair. The given sentence states that Ravi is bald. Hence ‘bald’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  two  brothers  ______when  their father died. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: fell out - to have an argument that ends a relationship.

question: The  teacher  asked  the  students  to ______  electricity  by  switching  off  lights when they left the room. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: save The given sentence states that the teacher asked the students to save electricity by switching off lights when they left the room. Hence ‘save’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select  the  most  appropriate  article to ﬁll in the blank. _________ bed you sleep in is broken. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: The ‘Bed’ mentioned in the given sentence is speciﬁc and we generally use the deﬁnite article ‘the’ before any speciﬁc or particular noun. Hence, ‘the bed’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She could easily eat the _____biryani by herself. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: whole ‘Whole’ means all of something. The given sentence states that she could easily eat the whole biryani by herself. Hence, ‘whole’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select  the  most  appropriate  option that  collocates  with  ‘wish’  to  ﬁll  in  the blank. The genie asked Aladdin to ______a wish. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: Make ‘Make’ is the correct verb to use with ‘wish’. The phrase ‘make a wish’ means to wish for something. The given sentence states that the genie asked Aladdin to make a wish. Hence, ‘make’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  ________  gracefully  and  greeted the interview committee with respect. SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: smiled The given sentence states that she smiled gracefully and greeted the interview committee with respect. Hence, ‘smiled’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: My sister's paintings were www.ssccglpinnacle.com                                                 Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Fill in the blanks ________at the national museum. SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: on display ‘On display’ is the correct phrase used to indicate that something is being shown for public viewing. Similarly, my sister’s paintings were being shown for public viewing at the national museum. Hence, ‘on display’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Many  developing  nations  are having a _________economy these days. SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: hand in The phrasal verb ‘ hand in’ means to submit. The given sentence states that the teacher asked the students to submit their essays before the deadline. Hence, ‘hand in’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: And  to  think  after  all  these  years you  still  have  the  __________  to  say  such things to me! SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Evening)

question: Ram was praised for his________leadership. SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: visionary . ‘Visionary’ means having great plans for the future. The given sentence states that Ram was praised for his visionary leadership. Hence, ‘visionary’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The monster trucks have very__________ engines, they can probably  pull  a  train  coach  without  any problem. SSC CGL  01/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: powerful . ‘Powerful’ means having great strength or force. The given sentence states that the monster trucks have very powerful engines, they can probably pull a train coach without any problem. Hence, ‘powerful’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  contingent  managed  to ________ successfully. SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (4th Shift)

options.A: park the deal  (b) close the deal
options.C: heal the deal  (d) catch the deal

solution.explanation: close the deal. ‘Close the Deal’ means to make an agreement oﬃcial. The given sentence states that the contingent managed to make an agreement(close the deal) successfully. Hence, ‘close the deal’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: `The  interviewees  were  slowly becoming  impatient  as  they  were  left  to ______in the waiting room for hours. SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: cool their heels. ‘Cool their heels’ is an idiom that means someone is deliberately keeping you waiting, so that you get bored or impatient. The given sentence states that the interviewees were slowly becoming impatient as they were left to cool their heels in the waiting room for hours. Hence, ‘cool their heels’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: When  there  are  negative  and  toxic thoughts____  your  mind,  you  can  never think positively. SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: clouding ‘Clouding’ means to become or make something diﬃcult to see through. The given sentence states that when there are negative and toxic thoughts clouding your mind, you can never think positively. Hence, ‘clouding’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The little boy demanded colourful balloons, ribbons in the village fair. When the  father  didn't  pay  heed  to  his demands, the boy made a __________. SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: wry face ‘Wry face’ means to show disappointment towards something. The given sentence states that when the father didn't pay heed to his demands, the boy made a disappointed face. Hence, ‘wry face’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Be  it  a  chaat  or  a  refreshing lemonade,  lemon  is  the  need  of  the  hour in_____ summers. SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: scorching . ‘Scorching’ means very hot. The given sentence states that lemon is the need of the hour in very hot summers. Hence, ‘scorching’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  decided  to  ___________  as  we were missing him a lot. SSC CGL  03/12/2022 (1st Shift)

options.C: bring in a visit     (d) pay him a visit

solution.explanation: pay him a visit ‘Pay him a visit’ means to go somewhere to spend time with someone. The given sentence states that we decided to spend time with him as we were missing him a lot. Hence, ‘pay him a visit’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Our  school  had  decided  to  take  us to  the  Himalayas  for  excursion.  I  ________ to convince my mother to give consent. SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: left no stones unturned ‘Left no stones unturned’ is an idiom that means to do everything you can to achieve a good result. The given sentence states that the narrator did everything to convince his mother to give consent. Hence, ‘left no stones unturned’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He has experienced ______ abuse. SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: physical. ‘Physical’ means connected with your body rather than your mind. The given sentence states that he has experienced physical abuse. Hence, ‘physical’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: They supplied the required human resource_________. SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: faultlessly . ‘Faultlessly’ means in a way that is perfect or without mistakes. The given sentence states that they supplied the required human resource faultlessly. Hence, ‘faultlessly’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I listened to him with ________ attention. SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: rapt ‘Rapt’ means giving complete attention, or showing complete involvement. The given sentence states that the narrator listened to him with rapt attention. Hence, ‘rapt’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: They  hired  her  to  increase  sales, but her strategies failed to ____________. SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (4th Shift)

options.C: spill the beans    (d) get a second wind

solution.correct_answer: A. move the needle (b) burn bridges
solution.explanation: move the needle ‘Move the needle’ means to change a situation to a noticeable degree. The given sentence states that they hired her to increase sales, but her strategies failed to change the situation. Hence, ‘move the needle’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He booked the tickets for the show_____. SSC CGL 05/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: in advance. ‘In advance’ means ahead in time. The given sentence states that he booked the tickets for the show in advance. Hence, ‘in advance’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: This drama is extremely informative__________life in Roman times. SSC CGL 05/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: about . ‘About’ means a little more or less than. The given sentence states that this drama is extremely informative about life in Roman times. Hence, ‘about’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Arun  and  his  wife  were  ______  a baby boy after 18 years of their marriage. SSC CGL 05/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: blessed with. ‘Blessed with’ means to have something that you feel is special or lucky. The given sentence states that Arun and his wife were blessed with a baby boy after 18 years of their marriage. Hence, ‘blessed with’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  company’s  proﬁts  were  low and they were forced to __________ staff. SSC CGL 05/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

options.A: lisp off  (b) lay off  (c) lay on  (d) lie on

solution.explanation: lay off. ‘Lay off’ means to discharge a worker temporarily or permanently because of economic conditions or shortage of work. The given sentence states that the company’s proﬁts were low and they were forced to discharge the staff. Hence, ‘lay off’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  ensure  that  you  will  get  a __________  chauffeur  with  the  right  car  for your day. SSC CGL  06/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: uniformed. ‘Uniformed’ means wearing a uniform. The given sentence states that we ensure that you will get a uniformed chauffeur with the right car for your day. Hence, ‘uniformed’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  rubbed  her  hands  over  her arms,  and  then  ___________  her  purse, haded inside the convenience store. SSC CGL 06/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: grabbing . ‘Grabbing’ means to try to get or catch somebody/something. The given sentence states that she rubbed her hands over her arms, and then grabbing her purse, haded inside the convenience store. Hence, ‘grabbing’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  judge  directed  the  advocate general to _________ an enquiry on the case. SSC CGL 06/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: hold . ‘Hold’ means the act or manner of having somebody/something in your hand. The given sentence states that the judge directed the advocate general to hold an enquiry on the case. Hence, ‘hold’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Brady  straightened,  the  ________ baton in hand. SSC CGL 07/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: wooden . ‘Wooden’ means made of wood. The given sentence states that Brady straightened, the wooden baton in hand. Hence, ‘wooden’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: A faint mist ________ over the valley. SSC CGL 07/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: hung . ‘Hung’ means to stay in the air in a way that is unpleasant or threatening. The given sentence states that a faint mist hung over the valley. Hence, ‘hung’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The ________ weapons which are easily  available  in  the  market  are  a  big threat to the security of some nations. SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: ‘Deadly’ means causing or likely to cause death. The given sentence states that the deadly weapons which are easily available in the market are a big threat to the security of some nations. Hence, ‘deadly’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: This  year,  orange  prices  are forecast  to  grow,  despite  an  expected increase in global _______ . SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: ‘Production’ means the making or growing of something, especially in large quantities. The given sentence states that this year, orange

question: The  crowing  witch  released  a _________cackle  as  she  turned  the  boy into a beast. SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Loud . ‘Cackle’ means to laugh in a loud, harsh way. The given sentence states that the crowing witch released a loud cackle(laughed in a loud & harsh way) as she turned the boy into a beast. Hence, ‘loud’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Writing  down  instructions,  steps and remembering them can make you look really eﬃcient and ________. SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: ‘Diligent’ means having or showing care in one's work or duties. The given sentence states that writing down instructions, steps and remembering them can make you look really eﬃcient and diligent. Hence, ‘diligent’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  has_________  her  money  and jewellery to help the poor. SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: ‘Given away’ is a phrase that means to donate or to give a gift/money to someone. The given sentence states that she has given away her money and jewellery to help the poor. Hence, ‘given away’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Kajol  is  one  age’-defying  beauty and her sari collection is worth _________. SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: ‘Bookmarking’ means to mark or save something so that you can ﬁnd it easily again. The given sentence states that Kajol is one age-defying beauty and her sari collection is worth bookmarking. Hence, ‘bookmarking’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: A  gaggle  of  journalists  sit  in  a/an _________ foyer waiting impatiently. SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Hotel - an establishment providing accommodation, meals, and other services for travellers and tourists Attic - a space or room inside or partly inside the roof of a building Ranch - a large farm, especially in the western US and Canada, where cattle or other animals are bred and raised Croft - a very small farm around a house

question: I felt_________elated at the news. SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: ‘Strangely’ means in an unusual or surprising way. The given sentence states that the narrator felt strangely (surprisingly) elated at the news. Hence, ‘strangely’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: There was a ____________accident last  night  and  the  inspector  on  deputy was  unable  to  raise  help  when  she  called from the mountains. SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: ‘Serious’ means something severe in effect. The given sentence states that there was a serious accident last night and the inspector on deputy was unable to raise help when she called from the mountains. Hence, ‘serious’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: His  heart  pounded  as  he  checked his  rearview  mirror  and  saw  only  the  dark _______ of highway. www.ssccglpinnacle.com                                                 Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Fill in the blanks SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: Stretch ‘Stretch’ means a continuous area or expanse of land. The given sentence states that the one who is talked about in the sentence saw the dark expanse of highway in his rear view mirror. Hence, ‘stretch’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: After  a  tiring  day,  the  workers decided to_______ to restore their energy. SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Morning)

options.B: put a spoke in the wheel

solution.explanation: ‘ Hit the sack ’ is an idiom that means to go to bed. The given sentence states that after a tiring day, the workers decided to go to bed to restore their energy. Hence, ‘hit the sack’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: James  Bernard  was  undoubtedly one  of  the  greatest  elocutionists  of  the world. Everyone agreed that he possessed the_________. SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Morning)

options.C: curtain lecture     (d) gift of the gab

solution.explanation: gift of the gab ‘Gift of the gab’ is an idiom that means the ability to speak with eloquence and ﬂuency. The given sentence states that James Bernard was undoubtedly one of the greatest elocutionists of the world. Everyone agreed that he possessed the ability to speak with eloquence. Hence, ‘gift of the gab’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: It is never advisable to have an axe to ________. SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘ An axe to grind ’ is an idiom that means to have a private reason for doing or being involved in something. The given sentence states that it is never advisable to have a private reason for doing something.

question: The  annual  meeting  of  our  club has been ______ till next month. SSC CGL Tier II (08/08/2022)

solution.explanation: Deferred ‘Defer’ means to postpone. The given sentence states that the annual meeting of our club has been postponed till next month. Hence, ‘deferred’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The boy ______ to take the money. SSC CGL Tier II (08/08/2022)

solution.explanation: Refused ‘Refused’ means to say or show that you are not willing to accept something. The given sentence states that the boy refused(not willing) to take the money. Hence, ‘refused’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Easter  eggs  used  to  be  painted chicken  eggs,  but  a  modern________  is  to substitute  them  with  chocolate  eggs  or plastic  eggs  ﬁlled  with  confectionery such as jelly beans. Graduate Level 02/08/2022 ( Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Custom “Custom” means a traditional and widely accepted way of behaving or doing something that is speciﬁc to a particular society, place, or time. The given sentence states that Easter eggs used to be painted chicken eggs, but a modern custom is to substitute them with chocolate eggs or plastic eggs ﬁlled with confectionery such as jelly beans. . Hence, “Custom” is the most appropriate answer.

question: In  the  given  sentence,  a  word  is given  in  brackets.  Select  the  most appropriate  ANTONYM  of  the  word  to  ﬁll in the blank. The  kids  are  feeling  bored,  but  they  are ______  (eager)  to  participate  in  the activities. Graduate Level 02/08/2022 ( Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Reluctant Eager - having or showing desire or interest. Reluctant - not wanting to do something and therefore slow to do it. Passive - lacking in energy or will; lethargic. Nervous - appearing or acting unsteady, erratic, or irregular.

question: Countries  like  China  and  the United  States  invest  _______  in  wind, hydro, solar and biofuels. Graduate Level 02/08/2022 ( Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Heavily ‘Heavily’ means to a great degree or in a heavy manner. Hence, ‘Heavily’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Freud's work with free association,  dream  analysis  and  the unconscious  was  of  ________  importance to  the  Surrealists  in  developing  methods to liberate Imagination. Graduate Level 03/08/2022 ( Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: utmost ‘Utmost’ means the most extreme; greatest. The given sentence states that Freud's work with free association, dream analysis and the unconscious was of utmost importance. Hence, ‘utmost’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: New  York________its  roots  back  to 1624,  when  it  was  founded  as  a  trading post by colonists of the Dutch Republic. Graduate Level 04/08/2022 ( Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: Traces ‘Traces’ means a sign or evidence of some past thing. The given sentence states that New York traces its roots back to 1624, when it was founded as a trading post by colonists of the Dutch Republic. Hence, ‘traces’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: According  to  the  traditions,  Easter Sunday  is  celebrated  by  ____________  part in  an  Easter  vigil,  lighting  a  new  ﬁre outside the church early on Sunday www.ssccglpinnacle.com                                                 Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Fill in the blanks morning. Graduate Level 04/08/2022 ( Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: taking The phrase ‘take part’ means to join in an activity or be involved. The given sentence states that Easter Sunday is celebrated by taking part in an Easter vigil. Hence, ‘taking’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Stereotypes  may  be  used  to justify  ill-founded  ________  or  ignorance, and prevent people  of  stereotyped groups  from  entering  or  succeeding  in various activities or ﬁelds. Graduate Level 05/08/2022 ( Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Prejudices ‘Prejudices’ means a preconceived opinion that is not based on reason or actual experience. The given sentence states that Stereotypes may be used to justify ill-founded prejudices or ignorance, and prevent people of stereotyped groups from entering or succeeding in various activities or ﬁelds. Hence, ‘prejudices’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  blue  embroidered  saree  is  no doubt  an  ________  piece  of  handwork,  but because  of  its  _______  price  no  one  was ready to buy it. Higher Secondary 01/08/2022 ( Shift - 3 )

solution.explanation: exquisite; exorbitant Exquisite means extremely beautiful and delicate and exorbitant means unreasonably high. The given sentence states that The blue embroidered saree is no doubt an exquisite piece of handwork, but because of its exorbitant price no one was ready to buy it. Hence, ‘exquisite; exorbitant’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: His_____________violation  of  the moral code of conduct was too_________to be forgiven. Higher Secondary 04/08/2022 ( Shift - 3 )

solution.explanation: Flagrant ; Outrageous Flagrant means conspicuously offensive & Outrageous means exceeding the limits of what is usual. The given sentence states that his ‘ﬂagrant violation of the moral code of conduct was too outrageous to be forgiven’. Hence, ‘Flagrant & Outrageous’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  ______  of  the  knife  in  his hand made her sick. SSC MTS 05/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Sight’ means to suddenly see something or someone. The given sentence states that suddenly seeing a knife in his hand made her sick. Hence, ‘sight’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The ______ needs of the inhabitants  seem  to  be  fruit,  iced  drinks, shiny boots and lottery tickets. SSC MTS 05/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Principle’ means the most important thing. The given sentence states that the most important needs of the inhabitants seem to be fruit, iced drinks, shiny boots and lottery tickets. Hence, ‘principle’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: There  are  good  points  to  each side  and  we  need  more  ______  people that  are  willing  to  look  at  them  from  all angles. SSC MTS 05/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: unbiased ‘Unbiased’ means fair and not likely to support one particular person or group involved in something. The given sentence talks about some people who are not likely to support one side and are willing to look at each side from all angles. Hence, ‘unbiased’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: One  of  the  children  stood  at  the door  to  ______  if  he  saw  the  apparitor coming,  who  was  an  oﬃcer  of  the spiritual court. SSC MTS 05/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘ Give notice ’ is a phrase that means to inform or warn someone of something. The given sentence states that one of the children stood at the door to inform of the apparitor’s arrival. Hence, ‘give notice’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  boys  were  tired,  but  not  too tired to examine the little hut ______ SSC MTS 06/07/2022 (Morning)
Thus, ______ of their purpose, the three knights tried another plan. SSC MTS 06/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Foiled’ means to prevent a plan from succeeding. The given sentence states that the three knights didn’t succeed in their purpose so they tried another plan. Hence, ‘foiled’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: In  all  cases,  we  have  to  ______  the facts  from  the  various  reports  and documents. SSC MTS 06/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Distil’ means to extract the essence of something. The given sentence states that in all cases, we have to extract the facts from the various reports and documents. Hence, ‘distil’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  ocean  waves  swelled  and reached  ______  her  head,  and  she  started screaming. SSC MTS 06/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Above’ means higher than or overhead. The given sentence states that the ocean waves swelled and reached above her head, and she started screaming. Hence, ‘above’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  US  has  become  far  more ______  to  people  with  all  kinds  of  food sensitivities and diet regimens. SSC MTS 07/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Accommodating’ means agreeing to do or provide what somebody wants. The given sentence states that the US has become far more accommodating to people with all kinds of food sensitivities and diet regimens. Hence, ‘accommodating’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: All  of  my  efforts  to  save  her  life have gone in ______. SSC MTS 07/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Vain’ means failing to produce the result you want. The given sentence states that all of my efforts to save her life failed to produce results. Hence, ‘vain’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  garret  where  he  lay  at  night had  long  been  ______,  and  a  great  number of mice had made their home in it. SSC MTS 07/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Vacant’ means not being used. The given sentence states that the garret where he lay at night had long been vacant, and a great number of mice had made their home in it. Hence, ‘vacant’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Ms.  Gupta  expressed  her  ______ for my political understanding. SSC MTS 08/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Admiration’ means a feeling of liking and respecting somebody / something very much. The given sentence states that Ms. Gupta expressed her admiration for my political understanding. Hence, ‘admiration’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Danny lay on his back staring at the ______ of his room. SSC MTS 08/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Ceiling’ means the top surface of the inside of a room. The given sentence states that Danny lay on his back staring at the top surface of his room. Hence, ‘ceiling’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  girl  ran  into  the  house  to  get some  ______  of  bread,  cold  potatoes  and other  such  morsels  that  were  suitable  for the fowls. SSC MTS 11/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Crumbs’ means a very small dry piece of bread. The given sentence states that the girl ran into the house to get some crumbs of bread. Hence, ‘crumbs’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Sun  Tzu  says  that  ______  the enemy  without  battle  requires  greater skill than winning on the battleﬁeld. SSC MTS 11/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Defeating’ is a gerund that means to win a game, a ﬁght, a vote, etc. against somebody. The given sentence states that Sun Tzu says that defeating the enemy without battle requires greater skill than winning on the battleﬁeld. Hence, ‘defeating’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: A  person  must  speak  eloquently and ______ while making a speech. SSC MTS 11/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Politely’ means behaving in a way that shows good manners toward others. The given sentence states that a person must speak eloquently and politely while making a speech. Hence, ‘politely’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  sudden  death  of  our  uncle was ______________ for all of us. SSC MTS 12/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Tragic’ means that makes you very sad, especially because it involves death. The given sentence states that the sudden death of our uncle was tragic for all of us. Hence, ‘tragic’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Thinking  of  talent  as  innate makes  our  world  more  manageable  and more comfortable as it relieves a person of the _______ of expectation. SSC MTS 12/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Burden’ means a responsibility or diﬃcult task that causes a lot of work or worry. The given sentence states that thinking of talent as innate makes our world more manageable and more comfortable as it relieves a person of the burden of expectation. Hence, ‘burden’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: As  he  went  through  the  street  on an  ______  that  morning,  he  saw  a  woman with a cat under her arm. SSC MTS 12/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Errand’ means a short journey to take or get something for somebody. The given sentence states that as he went through the street on an errand that morning, he saw a woman with a cat under her arm. Hence, ‘errand’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  situation  turned  ugly  as  the crowd ______ to riot. SSC MTS 12/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: The given sentence is in the simple past tense so the verb must be used in the simple past form(V 2 ). Hence, ‘began(V 2 )’ is the most appropriate

question: But  if  you  ______  to  spare  before you do catch the bus, be sure to pop in. SSC MTS 14/07/2022 (Morning)

options.A: have a meeting   (b) have a moment

solution.explanation: ‘ Have a moment ’ means have a short period of time available for something. The given sentence states that if you have a short period of time available to spare before you do catch the bus, be sure to pop in. Hence, ‘have a moment’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: John ran pretty fast, ______________ he did not win the race. SSC MTS 14/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Though’ means in spite of the fact that. The given sentence states that John ran pretty fast, though he did not win the race. Hence, ‘though’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  ______  learn  to  meet  adversity gracefully. SSC MTS 14/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Must’ means used for saying that it is necessary that something happens. The given sentence states that we must learn to meet adversity gracefully. Hence, ‘must’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  deplore  the  use  of  ______ against innocent people. SSC MTS 14/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Violence’ means behaviour which harms or damages somebody/something physically. The given sentence states that we deplore the use of violence against innocent people. Hence, ‘violence’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: India  continues  to  ____________ the  highest  amount  of  e-waste,  more than China, the US, Japan and Germany. SSC MTS 14/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Generate’ means to produce or create something. The given sentence states that India continues to generate the highest amount of e-waste, more than China, the US, Japan and Germany. Hence, ‘generate’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  ______  of  directors  will  decide the penalty. SSC MTS 15/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Board’ means a group of people who control an organization, company, etc. The given sentence states that the board of directors will decide the penalty. Hence, ‘board’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  reality  of  the  effects  of  rising aviation  industry  emissions  on  climate change  has  been  known  for  decades,  yet the industry and its emissions has continued to grow  without _________. SSC MTS 15/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Constraint’ means something that limits you. The given sentence states that the industry and its emissions has continued to grow without constraint. Hence, ‘constraint’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He  didn't  tell  me  anything  ______ that he needed some money. SSC MTS 15/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Except’ means not including somebody/something. The given sentence states that he didn't tell me anything except that he needed some money. Hence, ‘except’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  commander  abjured  his ______to the king. SSC MTS 15/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Allegiance’ means support for a leader, government, belief, etc. The given sentence states that the commander abjured his allegiance to the king. Hence, ‘allegiance’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Mr.  Pearson interrupted their harmless  ______  and  reminded  them  of the seriousness of the situation. SSC MTS 15/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Chatter’ means to talk quickly or for a long time about something unimportant. The given sentence states that Mr. Pearson interrupted their harmless chatter and reminded them of the seriousness of the situation. Hence, ‘chatter’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  refused  to  back  ______,  so she was ﬁred from the company. SSC MTS 15/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘ Back down’ means to admit that you were wrong. The given sentence states that she refused to admit that she was wrong, so she was ﬁred from the company. Hence, ‘down’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  Intergovernmental  Panel  on Climate  Change  (IPCC)  ______  the  idea  of ‘tipping points’ two decades ago. SSC MTS 15/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Introduced’ means to bring in something new for the ﬁrst time. The given sentence states that the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) introduced the idea of ‘tipping points’ two decades ago. Hence, ‘introduced’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  smashed  a  ______  of  glass with the metal vase. SSC MTS 18/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Pane’ means a piece of glass in a window, etc. The given sentence states that she smashed a pane of glass with the metal vase. Hence, ‘pane’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Most  mainliners  do  not  view modern  culture  as  inherently  ______  to religious belief. SSC MTS 18/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Inimical’ means harmful to something. The given sentence states that most mainliners do not view modern culture as inherently inimical to religious belief. Hence, ‘inimical’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: ______  I  learned  that  there  was  a gift for each child, I was delighted. SSC MTS 18/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘When’ is used for talking about the time at which something happens. The given sentence states that when I learned that there was a gift for each child, I was delighted. Hence, ‘When’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  skill  of  execution  is  viewed  as inseparable  from  art,  and  mastery  of technical  problems  is  a  ______  for producing expressive interpretations. SSC MTS 19/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Precondition’ means something that must happen or exist before something else can exist. The given sentence states that the skill of execution is viewed as inseparable from art, and mastery of technical problems is a precondition for producing expressive interpretations. Hence, ‘precondition’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  can’t  ﬁt  this  teddy  bear  in  my almirah. It is so ______. SSC MTS 19/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Gigantic’ means extremely big. The given sentence states that I can’t ﬁt this teddy bear in my almirah. It is so gigantic. Hence, ‘gigantic’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  bank  was  prepared  to  ______ chance  and  lend  him  40%  of  the purchase price. SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘ Take a chance’ is a phrase that means to put one's trust in something or someone knowing that it may not be safe or certain. The given sentence states that the bank was prepared to take a chance and lend him 40% of the purchase price. Hence, ‘take a’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  Armenian  language  has many  dialects,  some  of  which  cannot  be ______ by speakers of other dialects. SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Understood’ means to know or realize the meaning of something. The given sentence states that the Armenian language has many dialects, some of which cannot be understood by speakers of other dialects. Hence, ‘understood’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The RTE Act bears many similarities  to  the  US's  No  Child  Left Behind  Act,  ______school  accountability, assessment standards and teacher training. SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Including’ means having as a part. The given sentence states that the RTE Act bears many similarities to the US's No Child Left Behind Act, including school accountability, assessment standards and teacher training. Hence, ‘including’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Several  pictures  and  videos  have been  circulating  ______  social  media featuring her. SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: The given sentence states that several pictures and videos have been circulating on social media featuring her. Hence, ‘ on ’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Only  30  percent  worked  in companies  where  paternity  leave  was an_____. SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Entitlement’ means the oﬃcial right to have or do something. The given sentence states that only 30 percent worked in companies where paternity leave was an entitlement. Hence, ‘entitlement’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  lottery  is  a  regular  weekly _______where  the  drawing  of  the  numbers is done by a little girl. SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Recreation’ means enjoying yourself and relaxing when you are not working. The given sentence states that the lottery is a regular weekly recreation where the drawing of the numbers is done by a little girl. Hence, ‘recreation’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Anita looked______the word in the www.ssccglpinnacle.com                                                 Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Fill in the blanks dictionary, but she still did not understand it. SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘ Look up ’ means to check a fact or get information about something. The given sentence states that Anita looked up the word in the dictionary, but she still did not understand it. Hence, ‘up’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  need  to____  for  next  week,  so are you in or out? SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Plan’ means a detailed scheme, method, etc, for attaining an objective. The given sentence states that we need to make plans for next week, so are you in or out. Hence, ‘make plans’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: This  small  hut  is  going  to  be my____for the next three days. SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Abode’ means the place where you live. The given sentence states that this small hut is going to be my abode for the next three days. Hence, ‘abode’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Food  was_____;  guides  were  not to be found, and the enemy dogged them all the way. SSC MTS 22/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Scarce’ means insuﬃcient to satisfy the need or demand. The given sentence states that food was scarce;

question: It  was  a  long  and  dangerous journey  in  those  unsettled  days.  The pilgrim had to face______by land and sea. SSC MTS 25/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Peril’ means something that is very dangerous. The given sentence states that the pilgrim had to face perils by land and sea. Hence, ‘perils’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Farmers  are  urged  to  ______  to good agricultural practices in the disposal and spreading of agricultural wastes such as slurry. SSC MTS 25/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Adhere’ means to stick ﬁrmly to something. The given sentence states that farmers are urged to adhere to good agricultural practices in the disposal and spreading of agricultural wastes such as slurry. Hence, ‘adhere’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Most  natural  diamonds  have some type of______. SSC MTS 26/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Flaw’ means a mistake in something that makes it not good enough. The given sentence states that most natural diamonds have some type of ﬂaw. Hence, ‘ﬂaw’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: When  we  believe  that  our  mind  is thinking ______ thoughts at the same time,  what  actually  is  happening  is  that __________  thoughts  are  __________  in such  quick  ___________  so  as  to  seem simultaneous SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: We will use the words ‘multiple’ & ‘myriad’ in the given sentence because they are generally used before a plural noun(thoughts). However, all the remaining words given in option c perfectly ﬁt in the context of the given sentence.

question: My  grandfather  was  a  farmer  and he ___________three acres of land. SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Cultivate’ means to prepare and use the land for growing plants for food or to sell. The given sentence states that the narrator’s grandfather was a farmer and he cultivated three acres of land. Hence, ‘cultivated’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  __________  crowd  gave  their newly  elected  leader  a  magniﬁcent welcome. SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Jubilant’ means extremely happy, especially because of success. The given sentence states that the jubilant crowd gave their newly elected leader a magniﬁcent welcome. Hence, ‘jubilant’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Manpower exporters and overseas  recruiters  commonly  __________ in illegal business practices for short-term _______ gain. SSC CHSL  25/05/2022, (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Indulged’ means to allow yourself to have or do something & ‘Monetary’ means connected with money. Similarly, the given sentence states that manpower exporters and overseas recruiters commonly allow themselves of doing illegal business practices & making short-term money. Hence, ‘indulged, monetary’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: As  soon  as  she  opened  the cages, the birds __________. SSC CHSL 26/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: The given sentence is in the simple past tense so the verb must be used in its simple past form(V 2 ). Hence, ‘ﬂew(V 2 ) away’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The minute you start _______ and tolerating  __________,  it  becomes  the  new norm  and  the  slide  begins  and  therefore, we  must  constantly  __________  to  give  our best  and  be  recognised,  not  simply  aim to  do  just  enough  to  ___________  that  we don’t get found out. SSC CHSL 26/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: It can be inferred from the given sentence that only option (b) has all the correct words that will ﬁt in the blanks.

question: A  note  of  ______  during  the leaders' meeting at the UN. SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Discord’ means disagreement or argument. The given sentence states that a note of discord surfaced during the leaders' meeting at the UN. Hence, ‘discord surfaced’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: In  a  _______  move,  the  robbers chose  their  next  place  of  attack  over  255 km  away  from  the  locations  they  had earlier ________ in Dewas. SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Shrewd’ means to be able to make good decisions because you understand a situation well & ‘targeted’ means to try to attack somebody/something. However, the given sentence states that the robbers were able to make good decisions so they chose their next place of attack over 255 km away from the locations they had earlier tried to attack. Hence, ‘shrewd, targeted’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Very  carefully  I  ______  the  tree  I have  referred  to,  and  avoiding  contact with  the  creepers,  the  upper  _______  and leaves  of  which  might  have  been  visible from  where  the  tiger  was  lying,  I  climbed to the fork, where I had a comfortable seat and perfect _________. SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: The words written in option d will perfectly ﬁt in the blanks according to the grammatical context of the sentence. Stalk - to follow someone Concealment - hide Tendrils - a long thin part that grows from a climbing plant

question: Many  times  ________  starts  with the  creative  _________  and  the  enduring passion of a single individual. SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Innovation’ means a new idea, method, or device & ‘spark’ means an exciting quality that somebody/something has. The given sentence states that many times innovation starts with the creative spark and the enduring passion of a single individual. Hence, ‘innovation, spark’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Towards  the  end  of  February  the weather turned very ______. SSC CHSL 01/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Mild’ means not strong. The given sentence states that towards the end of February the weather turned very mild. Hence, ‘mild’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  would  have  loved  to  stay _______ like children all our lives. SSC CHSL 01/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Innocent’ means not having done something wrong or having no knowledge of the unpleasant and evil things in life. The given sentence states that we would have loved to stay innocent like children all our lives. Hence, ‘innocent’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural  Employment  Guarantee  Act  2005 (Mahatma  Gandhi  NREGA)  aims  at enhancing  _______security  of  households in  rural  areas  of  the  country  by  providing at  least  one  hundred  days  of  guaranteed wage  employment  in  a  ﬁnancial  year  to every  household  whose  adult  members volunteer to do unskilled manual work. SSC CHSL 01/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Livelihood’ means the way that you earn money. The given sentence states that The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act 2005 (Mahatma Gandhi NREGA) aims at enhancing the livelihood security of households in rural areas of the country. Hence, ‘livelihood’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Other  countries  of  comparable size  and  exposure  to  Information  and Communication  Technologies  (ICT)  have adopted  a  decentralised  organizational structure, liberal policies, and a __________ dispute resolution mechanism, deployed state-of-the-art infrastructure  and  used  the  private- public  partnership  to  market  Domain Name Registration Services (DNS), resulting  in  phenomenal  growth  of  their country code domain name. SSC CHSL 02/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Comprehensive’ means including everything or nearly everything that is connected with a particular subject. The given sentence states that other countries of comparable size and exposure to Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) have adopted a decentralised organizational structure, liberal policies, and a comprehensive dispute resolution mechanism. Hence, ‘comprehensive’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He is a ______ in shining armour. SSC CHSL 02/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Knight’ means a person who has been given a title of honour by a king or queen for good work. The given sentence states that he is a knight in shining armour. Hence, ‘knight’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  love  to  swing  from  the branches _______ the pond. SSC CHSL 03/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Over’ means straight above something, but not touching it. The given sentence states that we love to swing from the branches over the pond. Hence, ‘over’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Two  __________  control  the  judge’s decision: justice and impartiality. SSC CHSL 03/06/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Principle’ means a rule for good behavior, based on what a person believes is right. The given sentence states that two principles control the judge’s decision: justice and impartiality. Hence, ‘principles’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The Young Global Leaders Community  is  an_______for  a  dynamic community  of  exceptional  people  with the  vision,  courage,  and  inﬂuence  to  drive positive change in the world. SSC CHSL 06/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Accelerator’ means a person or thing that accelerates or increases the speed of something. The given sentence states that the Young Global Leaders Community is an accelerator for a dynamic community of exceptional people with the vision, courage, and inﬂuence to drive positive change in the world. Hence, ‘accelerator’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Constructive  thinking  should  be developed through _________ reading. SSC CHSL 06/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Extensive’ means large in area or amount. The given sentence states that constructive thinking should be developed through extensive reading. Hence, ‘extensive’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: In  the  Second  World  War,  the British  __________  thousands  of  so-called interceptors  –  mostly  women  –  whose job  it  was  to  tune  in  every  day  and  night to  the  radio  _______  of  the  various divisions of the German military. SSC CHSL 06/06/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Broadcast is a verb it means to transmit (a programme or some information) by radio or television. And broadcast is available only in option c. Also when people get together at a certain place the verb used is assemble. Hence option c is the most appropriate answer.

question: A  major  ________  of  modern  times is  that  we  have  come  to  assume  that  all creation  is  ________  to  the  material interests of us, the homo-sapiens inhabiting  earth,  which  has  cut  the _________ relationship we otherwise enjoyed with other constituents  of creation. SSC CHSL 07/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: The ﬁrst blank will be ﬁlled by the word fallacy. Fallacy means a mistaken belief. The word assume is used in the ﬁrst part of the sentence which hints at the word fallacy. Assume means to suppose something without proper facts and this leads to a fallacy.So a is the most appropriate answer.

question: The world is constantly living in risk, uncertainty and fear of _________. SSC CHSL 09/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: The word to be used has to be paired with uncertainty which is a negative word. When two words are joined by and they should be similar. So the other word should also be negative. So death is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  raced  ______  towards  the train. SSC CHSL 09/06/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Frantically means in a hurried, excited, or disorganized manner.

question: The  young  king  tried  to  speak,  but his tongue seemed to ________ the roof of his mouth, and his lips refused to move. SSC CHSL 09/06/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Cleave to means to stick closely to something. So option b is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  never  could  quite  get  the  idea ________  my  mind  that  I  should  do  some teaching,  yet  I  felt  a  great  deal  of satisfaction with the pastorate. SSC CHSL 10/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Out of my mind” means to make yourself stop thinking about something.

question: Wise managers _________ opinions,  get  information,  ask  advice,  act ________and know the art of _____________ responsibilities to the subordinates. SSC CHSL 10/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Solicit means to ask for or try to obtain (something) from someone. Transparently is in an honest and open manner. Delegating means to entrust (a task or responsibility) to another person.So option b is the most appropr +iate answer.

question: Their  idea  of  a  holiday  ______  at  a luxury resort. SSC CGL 11/04/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: “is + V - ing” will be the correct grammatical structure for the given sentence. Hence, ‘is relaxing’ is the most appropriate answer.
