question: All  the  guests  were  shocked  at his ______ laughter. SSC CGL  18/04/2022(afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Unrestrained’ means not limited or controlled. The given sentence states that all the guests were shocked at his unrestrained laughter. Hence, ‘unrestrained’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  teacher  kept  stopping  her online lesson ______ to check if her students were following it. SSC CGL  18/04/2022(Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Occasionally’ means not often or regular. The given sentence states that the teacher kept stopping her online lesson occasionally to check if her students were following it. Hence, ‘occasionally’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: People  all  over  the  world  are concerned  about  the  human  right  to  live with ______. SSC CGL  18/04/2022(Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Dignity’ means the quality or state of being worthy.Dignity also means calm, serious behaviour that makes other people respect you. The given sentence states that people all over the world are concerned about the human right to live with dignity. Hence, ‘dignity’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  new  Vande  Bharat  trains  will have  some  additional  ______  such  as emergency windows for  evacuation, disaster lights etc. SSC CGL  21/04/2022(Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Features’ means important or noticeable parts of something. The given sentence states that the new Vande Bharat trains will have some additional features such as emergency windows for evacuation, disaster lights, etc. Hence, ‘features’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: In  the  absence  of  the  Principal, the Vice- Principal ______ for him. SSC CGL Tier II (29/01/2022)

solution.explanation: oﬃciates

question: The  workers  ______  against  the new labour laws. SSC CGL Tier II (29/01/2022)

solution.explanation: remonstrated ‘Remonstre’ means to protest or complain about somebody or something. Similarly in the given sentence, the workers are protesting or complaining against the new labour laws. Hence, ‘remonstrated’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He  was  ______  at  his  brother’s refusal to help him ﬁnancially. SSC CGL Tier II (29/01/2022)

solution.explanation: indignant ‘Indignant’ means shocked or angry & ‘angry/indignant at something’ will be the correct grammatical structure. However, the given sentence states that he was indignant(angry) at his brother’s refusal to help him ﬁnancially. Hence, ‘indignant’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Have you ______ with the diﬃculties you might have to face? SSC CGL Tier II (29/01/2022)

solution.explanation: reckoned “Reckon with” is a phrasal verb that means to consider something when making plans. Similarly, the given sentence talks about considering the diﬃculties one might have to face. Hence, ‘reckoned’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: All  is  calm  now  ______  the  heart  of Paris due to the lock-down. SSC CGL Tier II (03/02/2022)

solution.explanation: in We generally use the preposition ‘in' to show a place inside or to a position inside a particular area or object. Similarly, the given sentence talks about the place inside the heart of Paris. Hence, ‘in’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: ______ 540,000-square-foot building  now  houses  ______  enormous collection of artworks  and  historic archives. SSC CGL Tier II (03/02/2022)

solution.explanation: A; an The ‘building’ mentioned in the given sentence is non-speciﬁc and we generally use the indeﬁnite article ‘a’ before any non-speciﬁc or non-particular noun. However, the article ‘an’ is used before words starting with a vowel (A,E,I,O,U) for example, an educated person, an imminent danger, enormous collection(in the given sentence). Hence, ‘A, an’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  ______  for  a  vaccine  could take up to a year. SSC MTS 05/10/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: search “Search’ means to a act of trying to ﬁnd somebody/something. Search also means to examine somebody/something carefully because you are looking for something. The given sentence tells about the search for a vaccine. Hence, ‘search’ is the most appropriate answer. Chase means “to follow or pursue in order to catch.”The police chases thieves. Pursuit means “an activity of a special kind.” Track means “Marks or lines left by a person or a passing vehicle etc.”

question: ‘Several  peoples’  homes  were badly ______ during the ﬂoods. SSC MTS 05/10/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: damaged ‘Damaged’ means to spoil or harm something, for example by breaking it. The given sentence states that several peoples homes were badly damaged during the ﬂoods. Hence, ‘damaged’ is the most appropriate answer. Deluged means “a severe ﬂood.” Drained means “To cause water or a liquid to run out.”

question: They  looked  at  each  other  for  a moment  without  speaking  and  then  fell into a ______. SSC MTS 06/10/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: conversation ‘Conversation’ means a talk between two or more people. The given sentence states that they looked at each other for a moment without speaking and then fell into a conversation. Hence, ‘conversation’ is the most appropriate answer. Conﬁdence - the feeling or belief that one can have faith in. Conversion -the process of changing or causing something to change. Conviction - a ﬁrmly held belief.

question: ______  he  was  feeling  sick,  he  ate all the food. SSC MTS 07/10/2021(Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Although ‘Although’ means in spite of the fact that. The given sentence states that he ate all the food in spite of the fact that he was feeling sick. Hence, ‘although’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  terrorists  were  armed  ______ machine guns. SSC MTS 08/10/2021(Morning)

solution.explanation: with ‘Armed’ generally takes the preposition ‘with’ with it. However, the given sentence states that the terrorists were armed with machine guns. Hence, ‘with’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: My  employers  ______  my  salary last year. SSC MTS 11/10/2021(Morning)

solution.explanation: raised The given sentence is in the past tense(last year) so the verb must be used in its past form(raised). Hence, ‘raised’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Pravesh’s  teacher  makes  him  feel as if he is ______. SSC MTS 12/10/2021(Morning)

solution.explanation: incompetent ‘Incompetent’ means lacking the necessary skill to do something well. The given sentence states that Pravesh’s teacher makes him feel as if he is incompetent. Hence, ‘incompetent’ is the most appropriate answer. Inappropriate means not suitable. Inﬂuential means having the power to affect people Invisible means unable to be seen.

question: The  oﬃce  superintendent  asked me to leave my job application ______ him. SSC MTS 12/10/2021(Morning)
The  Blood  Finder  app  is  very useful in ______ the correct donor. SSC MTS 13/10/2021 (Morning)
______  it  was  snowing  we  decided to carry on driving in the mountains. SSC MTS 13/10/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Though ‘Though’ is a conjunction which means in spite of the fact that. The given sentence states that they continued driving in spite of the fact that it was snowing. Hence, ‘although’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Until  recently,  the  village  women ______  water  from  common  wells  or  hand pumps, but now they have water taps. SSC MTS 18/10/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: fetched The ﬁrst part of the given sentence has a sense of an activity done in the past so it must have a verb in the past tense. However, ‘fetch’ means to go to a place and bring back somebody/something like the women bringing back water in the given sentence. Hence, ‘fetched‘ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  totally  disagree  with  his  ______ proposal  as  he  has  not  weighed  the  pros and cons. SSC MTS 20/10/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ridiculous ‘Ridiculous’ means very silly or unreasonable. In the given sentence, the narrator disagrees with someone’s silly or unreasonable proposal. Hence, ‘ridiculous’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Once  the  interview  was  over  I ______ felt light and free. SSC MTS 20/10/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: suddenly ‘Suddenly’ means happening quickly and unexpectedly. The given sentence states that the narrator quickly felt light after the interview. Hence, ‘suddenly’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Some  of  Guru  Dutt’s  _________ classics  are  being  screened  on  MUBI these days. SSC MTS 20/10/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: unforgettable ‘Unforgettable’ means making such a strong impression that you cannot forget it. The given sentence talks about Guru Dutt's ﬁlms which we cannot forget. Hence, ‘unforgettable’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Watching one’s pet cat  is therapeutic  and  can  make  one  quite ______ to the real world outside. SSC MTS 20/10/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: oblivious ‘Oblivious’ means not noticing or realizing what is happening around you. The given sentence states that watching one’s pet can make someone stop realizing what is happening around him. Hence, ‘oblivious’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: They  ______  a  separate  cabin  to each employee. SSC MTS 22/10/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: allotted ‘Allotted’ means to give a share of work, time, etc. to somebody/something. The given sentence talks about giving a separate cabin to each employee. Hence, ‘allotted’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  effects  of  the  fuel  price  hike ______ severely even now. SSC MTS 26/10/2021 (Morning)

options.A: were being felt      (b) are being felt
options.C: has been felt         (d) is being felt

solution.explanation: are being felt ‘Effects’ is a plural subject so it will take a plural verb but in the present form(are)

question: Penguins are black and white sea birds  that  live  almost  ______  in  the  cold southern hemisphere. SSC MTS 26/10/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: exclusively ‘Exclusively’ means only & not involving anyone/anything else. The given sentence states that Penguins live exclusively(only) in the cold southern hemisphere. Hence, ‘exclusively’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  completed  my  learner’s  driving test  last  week.  When  am  I  going  to  get my ______ license? SSC MTS 27/10/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: permanent ‘Permanent’ means lasting for a long time or forever. Similarly, the given sentence talks about a permanent license that will last forever. Hence, ‘permanent’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The new recruit was ______ to impress his superiors. www.ssccglpinnacle.com                                                 Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Fill in the blanks SSC MTS 02/11/2021(Morning)

solution.explanation: eager ‘Eager’ means strongly wanting to do or have something. However, ‘Eager’ generally takes the preposition ‘to’ with it. Hence, ‘eager’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He  was  unpopular  with  his  team as he was a scheming and ______ person. SSC MTS 02/11/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: conniving ‘Conniving’ means to work secretly with somebody to do something that is wrong. The given sentence states that he was unpopular because of his bad qualities of scheming and conniving. Hence, ‘conniving’ the most appropriate answer.

question: India  is  formally  moving  ahead  to ______  21  MIG-29  and  12  Sukhoi-30MKI ﬁghters  from  Russia  along  with  upgrades of their existing ﬂeets. SSC CGL 13/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Procure means to obtain something, especially with diﬃculty. The given sentence states that India is formally moving ahead to procure 21 MIG-29 and 12 Sukhoi-30MKI ﬁghters from Russia. Hence, ‘procure’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  door  ______  in  the  strong wind. SSC CGL 13/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Slam means to shut or make something shut very loudly and with great force. The given sentence states that the door shut down loudly in the strong wind. Hence, ‘slammed’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: A  ______  souvenir  will  be  released on the occasion of the World Meet. SSC CGL 16/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Voluminous means something very large or bulky. The given sentence states that a very large souvenir will be released on the occasion of the world meet. Hence, ‘voluminous’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  ______  the  marks  of  the students on  different  subjects  and compared their performance for the year. SSC CGL  16/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Analyse’ means to look at or think about the different parts or details of something carefully in order to understand or explain it. The given sentence states that we analyze the marks of the students on different subjects and compare their performance for the year. Hence, ‘Analyse’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Social isolation, overcrowding, the ______  of  our  society  and  several  other factors are responsible for stress. SSC CGL  17/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Competitiveness means the ability to contend with rivals for the same goal or objective. The given sentence states that social isolation, overcrowding and competitiveness of our society, and several other factors are responsible for stress. Hence, ’competitiveness’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Some  patches  of  the  ______ garden have a rich cover of grass now. SSC CGL  17/08/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Sprawling means covering a large area of land. The given sentence states that some patches of the large garden have a rich cover of grass now. Hence, ‘sprawling’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Use  your  logical  thinking  for ______  decisions  today  as  you  will certainly succeed. SSC CGL  18/08/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Critical means describing the good and bad points of a play, ﬁlm, book, work of art, etc. The given sentence tells you to use your logical thinking for critical decisions today as you will certainly succeed. Hence, ‘critical’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  knew  that  to  apologise  would _____ to admitting she had failed SSC CGL  18/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Tantamount means having the same effect or value as something. The given sentence states that she knew that to apologize would be the same as admitting that she had failed. Hence, ‘tantamount’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Researchers  have  found  that  16 facial  expressions  ______  universally  in similar contexts across 12 world regions. SSC CGL  20/08/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Occur means to exist or be found somewhere. The given sentence states that researchers have found that 16 facial expressions occur universally in similar contexts across 12 world regions. Hence, ‘occur’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: In  addition  to  understanding  the speciﬁc issue to be tackled, the sub-committee examined the larger ______ on the problem. SSC CGL  20/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Perspective means your opinion or attitude towards something. The given sentence states that the sub-committee examined the larger perspective on the problem. Hence, ‘perspective’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The government has hardened its ______  against  the  agitators  and  imposed a curfew in the area. SSC CGL  23/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Stance means the opinions that somebody expresses publicly about something. The given sentence states that the government has hardened its stance against the agitators and imposed a curfew in the area. Hence, ‘stance’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  are  bewildered  by  the  power which  science  has  suddenly  placed  in our  laps,  and  we  are  ______  by  the realisation of our unpreparedness to deal with a crisis. SSC CGL  23/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Humble means to make somebody feel that he/she is not as good or important as he/she thought. The given sentence states that we are humbled by the realisation of our unpreparedness to deal with a crisis. Hence, ‘humbled’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  invention  of  fertilisers  and insecticides  has  increased  agricultural ______  which  is required  to  feed  the swelling population of the world. SSC CGL  23/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Output means the amount that a person or machine produces. The given sentence states that the invention of fertilizers and insecticides has increased agricultural output. Hence, ‘output’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: His  ______  of  the  topic  was  so good  that  students  had  few  doubts  at  the end of the class. SSC CGL  24/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Exposition means a comprehensive description and explanation of an idea or theory. The given sentence states that his comprehensive description(exposition) of the topic was so good that students had few doubts at the end of the class. Hence, ‘exposition’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Crowds  of  tourists  ______  across the square all day long. SSC CGL  24/08/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Flow means to move in a smooth and continuous way. The given sentence states that crowds of tourists ﬂowed across the square all day long. Hence, ‘ﬂowed’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: ______  of  adulterated  food  stuff being sold in the market. SSC CHSL 12/04/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Beware(used for giving a warning) means to be careful. The given sentence states to be careful of adulterated foodstuff being sold in the market. Hence, ‘beware’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Shekhar  Gupta  is  one  of  the ______ journalists of India. SSC CHSL 12/04/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Eminent’ means famous and important. The given sentence states that Shekhar Gupta is one of the famous and important journalists of India. Hence, ‘eminent’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  was  greatly  ______  by  the nightmare she had. SSC CHSL 12/04/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Perturbed means to make somebody worried or upset. The given sentence states that she was greatly worried or upset by the nightmare she had. Hence, ‘perturbed’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: As  far  as  he  is  ______,  he  will  love to attend the party. SSC CHSL 13/04/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Concerned means worried and feeling concerned about something. However, the phrase ‘ as far as I’m concerned ’ is used to indicate that you are giving your own opinion. Similarly, the given sentence states that the narrator is giving his own opinion about somebody that he will love to attend the party. Hence, ‘concerned’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He  was  not  ready  at  ﬁrst  to  come with us for the picnic but we ______him. SSC CHSL 13/04/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Persuaded means to make somebody believe something. The given sentence states that he was not ready at ﬁrst to come with us for the picnic but we made him believe us. Hence, ‘persuaded’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Courts  help  in  the  resolution  of ______ issues. SSC CHSL 13/04/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: ‘Contentious’ means likely to cause an argument. The given sentence states that courts help in the resolution of issues that are likely to cause arguments. Hence, ‘contentious’ is the most appropriate answer. Presumptuous:- Conﬁdent that something will happen or that somebody will do something without making sure ﬁrst, in a way that annoys people. Conscientious:- careful to do something correctly and well.

question: Can  you  please  ______  me  in sorting out these ﬁles on my computer? SSC CHSL 13/04/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Assist means to help someone in doing something. The given sentence states that can you please help me in sorting out these ﬁles on my computer. Hence, ‘assist’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Courts are ______ of the Constitution  as  they  are  expected  to  see that it is always respected. SSC CHSL 15/04/2021 (afternoon)

solution.explanation: Sentinels mean a soldier or guard whose job is to stand and keep watch. The given sentence states that Courts are guardians of the Constitution. Hence, ‘sentinels’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: According to  Soli  Sorabjee, listening  to  cases  being  argued  in  court can  be  ______  but  there  are  lighter moments too. SSC CHSL 15/04/2021 (afternoon)

solution.explanation: Tedious means boring and lasting for a long time. The given sentence states that listening to cases being argued in court can be boring. Hence, ‘tedious’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: There  is  an  ______  in  the advertising  company  for  a  copy  writer. SSC CHSL 16/04/2021 (afternoon)

solution.explanation: Opening means a job that is available. The given sentence states there is a job that is available in the advertising company for a copywriter. Hence, ‘opening’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Today you may not ______ what you hear, but that is the truth and you have to accept it. SSC CHSL 05/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: The meaning of the given options: Answer: to say or write something back to somebody who has asked you something Reply: to respond in words or writing Enjoy: to get pleasure from something Like: to enjoy something The sentence talks about telling and accepting the truth of someone(that person) and that person may or may not like it. So, ‘like’ is the most appropriate answer. Therefore, option d ﬁts the blank.

question: His  voice  was  ______  by  the  sound of the helicopter. SSC CHSL 05/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Let’s look into the meaning of the given words in the options- Drowned: To be so loud that you cannot hear somebody/something else Driven: to control or operate a car, train, bus, etc. Dawned: to begin to grow light, after the night Drawn: looking tired, worried, or ill. According to the sentence, ‘drowned’ is ﬁt to the given context of the sentence.

question: The  old  building  was  ______  by  the authorities. SSC CHSL 05/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: pulled down Let’s look into the meaning of the given words in the options - Pulled through : to survive a dangerous or diﬃcult situation Pulled down : demolish/crush Pulled up : to stop/scold Pulled off : succeed in achieving or winning something diﬃcult.

question: Despite  their  ______,  impersonal rules  that  apply  to  all  are  essential  in large systems. SSC CHSL 05/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: limitations Let’s look into the meaning of the given words in the options - Support : To help somebody by saying that you agree with him/her/it, and sometimes giving help such as money. Advantages : something that may help you to do better than other people Beneﬁts : an advantage or useful effect that something has Limitations : the act of limiting or controlling something; a condition that puts a limit on something Clearly, the word that we are looking for is limitations.

question: The  migrant  crisis  led  several states  to  ______  existing  labour  laws  in order to improve  their condition. SSC CHSL 06/08/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Amend means to change something slightly in order to make it better. Introduce - to bring in something new, use something, or take something to a place for the ﬁrst time Initiate - to start something Abandon - to leave somebody/something that you are responsible for, usually permanently Hence, ‘amend’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  air  ______  has  gone  up signiﬁcantly. SSC CHSL 10/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Fare means the amount of money you pay to travel by bus, train, taxi, etc. The given sentence states that the amount of money we pay to travel by air has gone up signiﬁcantly. Hence, ‘fare’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  mother  monkey  picked  up  her baby  and  climbed  up  the  tree  to  ______. SSC CHSL 10/08/2021 (afternoon)

solution.explanation: Safety - the state of being safe; not being dangerous or in danger. Ability - The mental or physical power or skill that makes it possible to do something. Cruelty - cruel behaviour Agility - the ability to move quickly or easily According to the context of the sentence, the mother monkey felt something dangerous. So, She climbed up the tree with her baby for safety.

question: Doctors  and  nurses  who  are treating  COVID-19  patients  are  ﬁnding  it diﬃcult ______ long working hours. SSC CHSL 11/08/2021 (Morning)

options.A: for manage with    (b) to cope with

solution.explanation: ‘ Cope with ’ means to deal successfully with a diﬃcult matter or situation. In this sentence doctors and nurses are ﬁnding it diﬃcult to deal with patients for long hours. So, option (b) is the most appropriate answer. Carry on - Continue an activity or task.

question: When  you  speak,  there  are gestures  and  body  language  that  ______ your words. SSC CHSL 11/08/2021 (afternoon)

solution.explanation: Accompany . Accompany - Be present or occur at the same time as (something else). Achieve - To complete something by hard work and skill Accomplish - To succeed in doing something diﬃcult that you planned to do Construct - Build or make Here the meaning of accompany is used to show that his gesture and the words take place at the same time. So, option (c) is the correct answer.

question: Delhi  University’s  new  institution called  School  of  Public  Health  will  offer  a ______ of programs. SSC CHSL 12/08/2021 (afternoon)

solution.explanation: Plethora means a very large amount of something, usually more than is needed or can be used. The given sentence states that Delhi University’s new institution called the School of Public Health will offer large amounts of programs. Hence, ‘plethora’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Poverty  was  staring  her  ______  the face. SSC CPO Tier II  (26/07/2021)

solution.explanation: ‘ Staring him/her in the face ’ is an idiom that is used for something that is apparent or simply visible to one. The given sentence states that poverty was staring her in the face which means poverty was apparent. Hence, ‘in’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The Allies ______ the war in 1945. SSC CPO Tier II  (26/07/2021)

solution.explanation: The given sentence talks about a war that took place in the past(in 1945), so it must have a verb in the past form (won). Hence, ‘won’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  request  the  favour  of  ______ granting me two days’ leave. SSC CPO Tier II  (26/07/2021)

solution.explanation: ‘Your’ is the second person possessive adjective that is used to describe something as belonging to you, for example, I wish I had your energy. However, ‘your’ is usually followed by a noun(including gerunds). Similarly, granting in the given sentence is a gerund. Hence, ‘your’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I ______ something burning now. SSC CPO 23/11/2020 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Stative verbs are those verbs which express a state of condition. They do not refer to a physical action. Sense and emotions like hear, smell, see, love, hate etc are different types of stative verbs. However, these verbs can’t be used in (-ing form) for example, Hear, Smell(Correct) and Hearing, Smelling(Incorrect). Hence, ‘I smell something burning’ will be the most appropriate answer.

question: She has inherited her fondness ______ tennis from her parents. SSC CPO 23/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Fondness from somebody’ and ‘fondness for something’ are the correct structure of the sentence. However, in the given question, she has fondness for tennis. Hence, ‘for’ will be the most appropriate answer.

question: ______!  What  have  you  done  to your hair? You are looking so odd. SSC CPO 23/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Goodness gracious will be the most appropriate answer. It is an exclamatory expression which is used to show sudden surprise. In the given question, the narrator is surprised by the odd hair cut by his/her acquaintance.

question: ______  of  our  success  depends  on our own efforts. SSC CPO 24/11/2020 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Few and many are used for countable nouns. But, Success is an uncountable noun. For uncountable nouns, we use ‘much’ like much of the work, much effort etc. Hence, much is the most appropriate answer.

question: ______  of  living  life  on  his  own terms, he made few compromises. SSC CPO 24/11/2020 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Desirous is an adjective which means having desire of something or being wishful for something. Hence, ‘desirous of’ will be the most appropriate answer.

question: ________! What a frightening experience it was! SSC CPO 24/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Oh Alas - used for showing sadness about something. Hurray - used for expressing great pleasure, approval. Bravo - a word that people shout to show that they have enjoyed something that somebody has done. However, in the given question, the exclamation “Oh!” will be the most appropriate answer because it is used to show a frightening/scary experience.

question: He was born in a business family and has  a  natural  aptitude  ______ business. SSC CPO 24/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: The phrase “Aptitude for something” is the correct structure of the sentence. It means the ability or talent for something. For example, aptitude for mathematics, aptitude for learning etc. Hence, “aptitude for business” will be the most appropriate answer.

question: The wise try to improve themselves ______ the fools keep blaming their luck. SSC CPO 24/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Whereas is a conjunction which is used for showing a fact that is different. For example, he eats meat, whereas she’s a vegetarian. Similarly in this question, the wise improves and the fool blames his luck(different fact). Hence, whereas will be the most appropriate answer.

question: The  fan  was  directly  ______  my head. SSC CPO 25/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Over is a preposition which means straight above something, but not touching it. Fans are usually on the ceiling. Hence, ‘fan was over my head’ is the most appropriate answer.
